intro: Chelone montana var. elatior, commonly known as the Canadian white flower or white helleborine, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of North America. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, spurred flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking native plant species.
